intro: Eriostemon banksii, commonly known as the Banks' eriostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and has a shrub-like appearance with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in racemes and bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Eriostemon banksii is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to coastal conditions with high salinity and wind exposure.
